string.name: name
string.value: The Mystery of the Red Portion
#b#@1020000:##k in #bPerion#k says he may be able to uncover the red portion of the #rDirty Treasure Map#k. Let's talk to him.

#b#@1020000:##k in #bPerion#k says he can recover the portion of the map covered in red if you bring him a #rFlint#k. (a drop item from #rDark Stumps#k that can be easily found in #b#m102020100##k.)\n\nReport back to #b#@1020000:##k in #bPerion#k upon completion.
#b#@1020000:##k in #bPerion#k suggests that you go to #b#@1022007:##k in #bPerion#k for additional information. But first, let's talk to #b#@1020000:##k.

string.name: rewardSummary
string.value: Exp 3,000 Able to proceed to 'Something's Lacking' as next quest.

Let me take a look at the map.\nWhat are all these colorful markings?\nIt seems like someone intentionally colored this map to prevent people from discovering what's on the map. I'm sure the map is hand-drawn, but it seems a bit too primitive.
I'm really curious about it. The prospect of finding treasures is quite exciting! Haha!\n\nI think I might be able to do something about the red area right here if you bring me a few things.
You're just as curious too, aren't you?\nMy experienced instinct tells me that you're not supposed to erase the red portion, but evaporate it using fire.

You'll be able to get #rFlints#k from hunting #rDark Stumps#k, and I just need 2 of them to build a fire that can evaporate the red ink. You'll be able to find a lot of #rDark Stumps#k in #b#m102020100##k.
Did you get everything? Here, let me see!

Here is the #rImproved Flint#k.

You'll see some changes if you open the map and place it over the Improved Flint.

Then come talk to me again. Hurry! I'm dying to know what happens!
